DOC.brief_title: Technology-assisted Case Management Adults With Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: The long-term goal develop practical sustainable system diabetes management help low income patient achieve maintain goal within establish treatment guideline regardless geographic location . This randomized clinical trial employ innovative FORA system , inexpensive , off-the-shelf , state-of-the-art technology comprise 2-in-1 Blood Glucose Blood Pressure monitor , couple nurse case management ( TACM ) optimize diabetes care low income , rural adult type 2 diabetes ( T2DM ) . The target population low income patient serve Federally Qualified Health Care Centers ( FQHCs ) poorly control T2DM reside coastal South Carolina . Two hundred patient randomly assign two group 100 patient ; Group A ( Usual Care ) Group B ( Technology-assisted Case Management , TACM ) . Each patient follow 6 month , study visit baseline , 3 , 6 month . The primary outcome Hemoglobin A1c ( HbA1c ) 6 month post-randomization secondary outcome blood pressure control quality life ( qol ) 6 month post-randomization .
